body_html: @AlexisTM No, but since the mac version is done this way I'm guessing the python version works too. Python 3.6 comes with some nice features although they are not necessary for me right now, but more importantly installing python 3.5 again and migrating all my libraries takes a lot of work, and it is a very annoying thing to downgrade just because of one library.
